title: ISic001351. Epitaph for Doxa
body:
1christogram
2Ἐνθάδε κεῖτε Δόξα
3ζήσασα ἔτη κη´
4τελευτᾷ τῇ πρὸ [.]
5καλ(ανδῶν) Ὀκτωβ[ρ(ίων)]
6Λ̣Σ̣ΣΑ.ΛΤ̣Η̣Η̣[---]

1christogram
2ΕΝΘΑΔΕΚΕΙΤΕΔΟΞΑ
3ΖΗΣΑΣΑΕΤΗΚΗ
4ΤΕΛΕΥΤΑΤΗΠΡΟ[·]
5ΚΑΛΟΚΤΩΒ[.]
6..ΣΑ·Λ...[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on photographs;
  • line.2: Δόξα lapis, Korhonen; Terramuzza: Δόλα; Ferrara, Wessel: Δόζα; Kirchhoff, Kaibel: Δόα; Ferrua: Δοία (= Gemina)
  • line.5: Wessel: ὀκτω[ρίων
  • line.6: Torremuzza: ..ΛΤΗΩ; Kirchhoff: ἡμέρᾳ ---; Kaibel: fortasse consules fuerunt; Ferrua: ΖΗΣΑΣΑ ΤΗΝΗ; Korhonen: .....Λ..ΙΙ[---]

English translation

Marta Fogagnolo

((Chi-Rho)) Here lies Doxa, having lived for 28 years. She died [-] before the Kalends of October…

Italian translation

Marta Fogagnolo

((Chi-Rho)) Qui giace Doxa, avendo vissuto per 28 anni. Morì [-] prima delle Calende di ottobre…

commentary

This Christian epitaph has the traditional formula ἔνθαδε κεῖται, the name of the deceased, the age and the date of death indicated by τελευτάω in the present form (see Korhonen 2004: 105-107). The last line is severely damaged and illegible, and Korhonen speculates that it may be a (later) graffito addition. The reading of Korhonen of the name of the deceased, Δόξα, is the only plausible reading, since Ferrua’s reading Δοία (from the Latin Gemina) is not otherwise attested (pace LGPN 3A: 133), nor is Terramuzza’s reading Δόλα and Ferrara’s reading Δόζα (Δόμνα is palaeographically improbable).

bibliography

  • Torremuzza 1769 247 no.23 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084
  • Torremuzza 1784 264 no.27 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083
  • Ferrara 1829 391 no.3 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002005
  • 14.0532 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 182 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • 4.9482 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • 1360 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Ferrua 1989 no.439 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
  • 105-107 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
